bioghist.p: Philadelphia-based Farm Journal was established in 1877 by Wilmer Atkinson. Throughout its history it has been known for its innovative publishing and advertising techniques. At its peak, the publication had a circulation of almost 3.7 million.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of company files of the Advertising and Production Departments of Farm Journal magazine. The materials date from the 1940s to the early 1970s. Included are: internal correspondence and correspondence with advertisers; production reports and statistics; advertising surveys, reports, and statistics; "job jackets" containing order information, production specifications, and proof copies of printing jobs; purchase orders and contracts for advertisements; coupon commission reports; promotion samples for Farm Journal and some of the magazine's advertisers, including posters, cards, pamphlets; subscription and renewal data; annual reports; audits; scrapbooks of Farm Journal publicity materials, press clippings, and "house ads" from trade magazines; a copies of the journal and special editions.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
